Comments_List: Learned tenses and vocabulary in Italian; learned how to manage lots of translations and to keep running lists of conjugations and vocab. Good reading proficiency by the end

Lots of work, more than other Yale online reading courses; some translations were from texts in archaic Italian dialects, or dialects for which we had no dictionary or knowledge; these were frustrating assignments, as well as those long translations of purple-prose Italian that violated the rules of grammar and sense we had been laboriously learning.

More quizzes and drills would be welcome, especially if the average length of translation were reduced, which would itself be for the best.

Exams were very fair; final project was well-conceived

I would recommend this course to any student who wants to learn Italian over the summer, especially to those who need to pass department tests or who are traveling during the week for work or conferences and can't commit to hours of in-person learning a day.
